title: Barbers In Pakistan Fined For Allegedly Styling Customers' Beards In An 'Un-Islamic Way'
text:
Four barbers from Pakistan were detained for styling their respective customers’ beards in an ‘Un-Islamic way’ in Pakistan’s Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, according to reports.

A local traders’ union had imposed a ban on the beard style which they termed as 'Un-Islamic'. The bizarre incident happened on September 30 and came to light after a video of the detained barbers went viral on social media.

The video garnered 39k views and 359 reactions. The video shows Sameen, president of the shopkeepers union, guiding the police to the barbers. He asked the hairdressers why they were shaping the beards of the customers in a stylish manner when there is a ban on the same, according to The Dawn.

Sameen also said that the union had recently, “banned the designing of beards" and had informed all hairdressers about it. "Despite our decision, some shop owners were trimming the beards in stylish designs," he said in the video.

He claimed that the police fined them Rs 5,000 each and warned them against styling beards in an ‘Un-Islamic way’ in the future.

"They (traders union) complained that despite a ban on giving a stylish shape to beards, some hairdressers were still doing so," an official from the Shabqadar police station said, adding that the barbers were released after a few hours in detention.

However, an official of the Charsadda District Police denied any police action against the barbers. Though he added that in a raid, hairdressers were arrested "to resolve a petty dispute between two hairdressers".
